newsitem.title: USA: Bay Networks says it completes acquisition.
newsitem.headline: Bay Networks says it completes acquisition.

text.p: Bay Networks Inc said Wednesday it has completed its $155 million stock acquisition of privately held Rapid City Communications.
Rapid City, which is based in Mountain View, Calif., develops Gigabit Ethernet and routing switch technologies.

Based on an average closing price of $23.619 for Bay Networks stock on the 20 days prior to the second trading day prior to the date of closing, Bay Networks will exchange or reserve 6,545,287 common shares in return for all of Rapid City's outstanding capital stock and employee stock options, the company said.
Bay Networks said it expects to recognize substantially all of the acquisition price as a one-time charge for in-process technology in its fourth fiscal quarter, which ends June 30.
